text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
be making Vietnamese sweet and sour fish
soup is called Kentucky in Vietnamese
this is one of the best dishes that can
represent Vietnamese cuisine because it
carries the freshness of the ingredients
the vegetables and hurts pick on social
case the balance of flavors and a great
hammer of texture so I hope you're gonna
like it
and let's begin
for this recipe you will need for
catfish steaks you can buy it fresh or
frozen an Asian grocery store bean
sprouts tomatoes
this is okra or ladyfingers in English a
popular vegetable in showers Asian
cuisine one elephant ear stem a very
spunky vegetable some spring onion and
rice paddy herbs firstly we gonna
lightly season our catfish Tech's with
salt pepper some chicken stock and chili
powder then lightly rub the seasoning on
the fish the chili powder and pepper
will help to reduce the fishy smell you
can also use foil a minced fresh chilies
make sure that you spread the seasoning
on both sides of the fish then set aside
for about 15 minutes next we're going to
cut the vegetables
remove the core of the pipe or and
slightingly into bite-size pieces
you only need a quarter of a pie apple
or 1 cup amount then cut tomato in half
remove the core and cut into wedges if
you have a big tomato you can cut each
wedge in half this is elephant ears stem
or back hair in Vietnamese
originally is connected to a large leaf
that looks like an elephant's ear as why
it's called elephant ear stem to spirit
and slightingly on a diagonal it's added
to the zoo because the sponginess
texture will absorb the flavor of the
zoo pretty well for the okras or our
ladies fingers just remove the stem and
also slightingly on the diagonal they
will add more texture to the soup
typical hurts the you for this soup is
sawtooth herbs is the same herbs that we
normally use for fall and this is rice
paddy herbs is calling our own is super
fragrant and it's so typical for this
dish that without it you can call it
Vietnamese sweet sour soup anymore I
can't think of any herbs that can
replace it really so just stack up the
herbs and chop them up if you don't have
salted hurts you can replace with spring
onion but rice paddy herbs is a
must-have now in a soup pot on
medium-high add 2 tbsp of vegetable oil
and fry 2 tbsp of minced garlic until
golden brown then transfer it to a small
bowl and set aside this will be used to
garnish the soup at the end this step is
optional but you can use some of your
oil to stir-fry some diced tomatoes so
this can infuse more into the broth and
also
very nice red color then fill the pot
with six cups or one and a half meters
of waters in a separate small saucepan
add one cup of water and 2 tablespoon of
tamarind pops you can buy this package a
station store bring it to a boil and you
are spoons to break up the tambourine
chunks this timer ring paste is what
make our soup sour just cook for 2
minutes and then transfer it to the
large soup pot through a strainer you
are spoon to press and force as much of
the tamarind through the sieve as
possible scrape off the bottom of the
sieve and discard the fibrous leftovers
now into the soup we can add 4 tbsp of
sugar I know that Sal lies a lot for a
savory soup but you really gonna need
that much because the tamarang is really
tart and sour then add 4 tbsp of fish
sauce for some saltiness this soup is
loved because a bit bold flavor so you
don't want to save on the seasonings now
bring it to a boil and after fit jung's
cook for 5 to 7 minutes until the fish
is done and then remove the fish from
the soup the reason I remove the fish
before adding the vegetables is that
it's very easy to overcook the fish when
you cook it together with the vegetables
and also it's easier to keep the fish in
its shape this way the soup is now also
enriched with the fish broth now we can
add in the vegetables pineapple and
tomatoes go in first then the elephant's
ear stem and okra
go for 1 to 2 minutes and then finally
add in the green scraps now have a taste
and adjust the broth to your liking with
salt sugar fish sauce or chicken stock
the soup is now packed of vegetables and
flavor is really really good just a
minute before something return the fish
to the soups to warm it up add the herbs
save a little for garnish just bring it
to a boil again and transfer to a
serving bowl
finally top up with the fried garlic oil
and some slices of red chillies the
fragrant fried garlic can make a lot of
difference to the soup so I really
recommend it that's it this is my spicy
savory sweet and sour fish soup it's
perfect for summer and also great for
any other seasons cooking the soup
overseas can be costly when I lived in
